Michael Feathers wrote:

> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> > Coolspot714 wrote:
> >
> > > I found tons of information about test-driven development and
> > > test-first, but hardly anything about writing tests after the
> > > application has been developed. Any experiences?
> >
> > This is untrue. Plenty has been written on the subject; however, you
> > might not be looking in the right places. On the extremeprogramming
> > Yahoo! group we talk about adding tests to existing code all the 
> time. :)
> >
> > Michael Feathers is completing a book entitled "Working Effectively with
> > Legacy Code" which contains hundreds of pages of advice in this
> > direction.
>
>
> Thanks, J.B.  I just received the book in my hands for the first time a
> few days ago.  Unfortunately, Amazon
> doesn't have its description info yet, but we have a link on the Object
> Mentor website:
>
> http://www.objectmentor.com/resources/bookstore/books/welc/
>
> I'll add a sample chapter to files section of this yahoo group too.

Congratulations! What a great feeling, eh?
